leaf_cluster.leaf_cluster_name: 天文-观测数据处理与源检测生态
leaf_cluster.task_chain: 校准→源检测→测光→匹配→平台

tools.name: ArtPop
tools.one_line_profile: Stellar population and galaxy image synthesizer
tools.detailed_description: ArtPop is a Python package for synthesizing stellar populations and simulating realistic images of galaxies. It allows users to generate artificial galaxies star-by-star, enabling detailed study of surface brightness fluctuations and other stellar population properties.

tools.name: ScopeSim
tools.one_line_profile: Telescope observation simulator
tools.detailed_description: ScopeSim is a flexible telescope observation simulator that generates simulated data based on the optical properties of the telescope, the detector, and the astronomical source. It is designed to support the development of data reduction pipelines and observation planning.

tools.name: GalFlow
tools.one_line_profile: Differentiable galaxy image simulation in TensorFlow
tools.detailed_description: GalFlow is a reimplementation of the GalSim galaxy image simulation toolkit using TensorFlow. It enables differentiable galaxy simulations, allowing for gradient-based optimization and integration with deep learning frameworks.

tools.name: GalSim
tools.one_line_profile: Modular galaxy image simulation toolkit
tools.detailed_description: GalSim is a modular software library for simulating images of galaxies and stars. It is widely used in the weak lensing community for testing shear measurement algorithms and generating realistic astronomical images with accurate PSF handling.

tools.name: JAX-GalSim
tools.one_line_profile: GPU-accelerated differentiable GalSim in JAX
tools.detailed_description: JAX-GalSim is a port of the GalSim library to JAX, providing GPU acceleration and automatic differentiation capabilities. It is designed for high-performance galaxy image simulation and analysis in differentiable cosmology workflows.

tools.name: STAR
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark for Astronomical Star Fields Super-Resolution
tools.detailed_description: STAR is a benchmark dataset and codebase for evaluating super-resolution algorithms on astronomical star field images. It provides a standardized environment for testing image restoration techniques in astronomy.

tools.name: imSim
tools.one_line_profile: Rubin Observatory image simulation package
tools.detailed_description: imSim is a high-fidelity image simulation package for the Vera C. Rubin Observatory, built on top of GalSim. It simulates the specific optical and detector characteristics of the LSST to generate realistic survey data.

tools.name: psf-weather-station
tools.one_line_profile: Atmospheric parameter generator for PSF simulations
tools.detailed_description: psf-weather-station is a tool designed to generate realistic atmospheric input parameters for Point Spread Function (PSF) simulations within the GalSim ecosystem, supporting accurate modeling of atmospheric effects on astronomical images.

tools.name: deep_galaxy_models
tools.one_line_profile: Deep generative models for GalSim
tools.detailed_description: This repository hosts code and models for integrating deep generative models (such as GANs or VAEs) into GalSim, allowing for the simulation of galaxy morphologies based on learned distributions.

tools.name: galsim_hub
tools.one_line_profile: TensorFlow modules interface for GalSim
tools.detailed_description: galsim_hub provides a collection of TensorFlow modules and an interface to easily use them within GalSim. It facilitates the use of deep learning-based galaxy models in standard simulation pipelines.

tools.name: AstroVisBench
tools.one_line_profile: Benchmark for astronomy visualization
tools.detailed_description: AstroVisBench is a benchmark suite designed to evaluate the performance and quality of scientific visualization techniques specifically for astronomical data.

tools.name: skymaker_pythonwrapper
tools.one_line_profile: Python wrapper for SkyMaker
tools.detailed_description: A Python wrapper for the SkyMaker software, enabling users to generate simulated astronomical images of stars and galaxies directly from Python scripts.

tools.name: dolphin
tools.one_line_profile: Automated lens modelling pipeline
tools.detailed_description: Dolphin is an automated pipeline for gravitational lens modelling built upon the Lenstronomy package. It streamlines the process of modeling lens systems from imaging data.

tools.name: astropy
tools.one_line_profile: Core package for Astronomy in Python
tools.detailed_description: Astropy is a community-driven core python package for Astronomy. It provides common tools such as units, coordinates, FITS file handling, and modeling frameworks essential for astronomical data analysis.

tools.name: SLITronomy
tools.one_line_profile: Sparse Lens Inversion Technique for Lenstronomy
tools.detailed_description: SLITronomy is a plugin for the Lenstronomy package that implements the Sparse Lens Inversion Technique (SLIT). It enables pixel-based source reconstruction for gravitational lensing analysis.

tools.name: great3-public
tools.one_line_profile: GREAT3 Challenge toolkit
tools.detailed_description: This repository contains the code and tools used for the Third Gravitational Lensing Accuracy Testing (GREAT3) challenge, including simulation scripts and metric evaluation tools.

tools.name: galight
tools.one_line_profile: Tool for decomposing astronomical light sources into PSF and Sersic profiles
tools.detailed_description: A Python package that decomposes light profiles into Point Spread Function (PSF) and Sersic components, utilizing lenstronomy for fitting, primarily for galaxy morphology analysis.

tools.name: synpipe
tools.one_line_profile: Synthetic object injection pipeline for Hyper Suprime-Cam data
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline designed to inject synthetic astronomical objects into Hyper Suprime-Cam (HSC) data to assess detection efficiency and measurement accuracy.

tools.name: Astrometry.net
tools.one_line_profile: Automatic astrometric calibration and recognition of astronomical images
tools.detailed_description: A reliable and robust system for astrometric calibration that takes an astronomical image and returns the astrometric solution (coordinates) without needing prior information.

tools.name: The Tractor
tools.one_line_profile: Probabilistic inference engine for measuring astronomical sources
tools.detailed_description: A modeling framework that performs probabilistic inference to measure properties of astronomical sources by optimizing likelihoods of image models.

tools.name: BALROG-MON
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline for antimicrobial resistance exploration in metagenomic samples
tools.detailed_description: A Nextflow pipeline designed for the exploration and analysis of Antimicrobial Resistance (AMR) genes within metagenomic sequencing data.

tools.name: Balrog
tools.one_line_profile: Image simulation software for the Dark Energy Survey (DES)
tools.detailed_description: A software pipeline used by the Dark Energy Survey to embed simulated objects into real images to characterize measurement biases and selection effects.

tools.name: morgoth
tools.one_line_profile: Pipeline for automatic Gamma-ray Burst Monitor (GBM) localizations
tools.detailed_description: A pipeline designed to automate the localization process for Gamma-ray Burst Monitor (GBM) data, facilitating rapid analysis of high-energy astrophysical events.

tools.name: photerr
tools.one_line_profile: Photometric error model for astronomical imaging surveys
tools.detailed_description: A Python library that provides photometric error models to simulate noise and uncertainties in astronomical imaging surveys.

tools.name: baobab
tools.one_line_profile: Training data generator for strong lensing hierarchical inference
tools.detailed_description: A tool to generate training data for Bayesian neural networks aimed at performing hierarchical inference on strongly-lensed systems.

tools.name: galaxies_datasets
tools.one_line_profile: Collection of extragalactic astronomy datasets for machine learning
tools.detailed_description: A Python package providing ready-to-use extragalactic astronomy datasets formatted for use with TensorFlow and other machine learning frameworks.

tools.name: JAXtronomy
tools.one_line_profile: JAX-based differentiable gravitational lensing simulation tool
tools.detailed_description: A JAX port of the lenstronomy package, enabling parallelized, GPU-accelerated, and differentiable gravitational lensing and image simulations.

tools.name: lenstronomy
tools.one_line_profile: Multi-purpose gravitational lens modeling software
tools.detailed_description: A comprehensive software package for modeling gravitational lenses, capable of image simulation, source reconstruction, and cosmological inference.

tools.name: legacy_sims_GalSimInterface
tools.one_line_profile: Interface for generating LSST simulated images using GalSim
tools.detailed_description: A software interface that connects LSST catalog simulations (CatSim) with GalSim to generate high-fidelity simulated astronomical images.

tools.name: legacy_sims_operations
tools.one_line_profile: LSST Operations Simulator (OpSim) package
tools.detailed_description: A package for the LSST Operations Simulator (OpSim), used to simulate and plan the survey strategy and scheduling for the Rubin Observatory.

tools.name: OPSim (Geant4)
tools.one_line_profile: Additions to Geant4 toolkit for optical photon simulation applications
tools.detailed_description: OpSim is a set of libraries and additions to the Geant4 simulation toolkit designed to simplify the implementation of optical photon applications and enhance flexibility in particle physics simulations.

tools.name: photometrypipeline
tools.one_line_profile: Automated photometry pipeline for small to medium-sized observatories
tools.detailed_description: An automated pipeline for performing photometry on astronomical images, designed to handle data from small to medium-sized observatories for scientific analysis.

tools.name: galaxy-datasets
tools.one_line_profile: Machine learning datasets and loaders for galaxy images
tools.detailed_description: A library providing easy access to machine-learning-friendly datasets of galaxy images and labels, facilitating astronomical deep learning research.

tools.name: analosis
tools.one_line_profile: Analysis tools for investigating line-of-sight effects in strong lensing
tools.detailed_description: A toolkit designed to work with lenstronomy for analyzing line-of-sight effects in strong gravitational lensing systems.

tools.name: OpSim (Chemical Engineering)
tools.one_line_profile: Open source Chemical Engineering Process Simulator
tools.detailed_description: A chemical engineering process simulator featuring a graphical user interface and a high-performance simulation engine for modeling chemical processes.

tools.name: cabaret
tools.one_line_profile: Simulation of astronomical images using Gaia catalog
tools.detailed_description: A Python package to simulate astronomical images based on star data from the Gaia catalog, useful for instrument calibration and observation planning.

tools.name: OpenTestability
tools.one_line_profile: Structural analysis tool for digital circuits and netlists
tools.detailed_description: An open-source tool for structural analysis of digital circuits, computing metrics like SCOAP and COP from Verilog netlists for hardware engineering and testing.

tools.name: Balrog (Bio)
tools.one_line_profile: Bacterial Annotation by Learned Representation of Genes
tools.detailed_description: A tool for bacterial gene annotation using learned representations, designed to predict gene functions in prokaryotic genomes.

tools.name: BalrogCPP
tools.one_line_profile: C++ implementation of Balrog for bacterial gene annotation
tools.detailed_description: The C++ version of the Balrog tool for efficient bacterial gene annotation and representation learning.

tools.name: hierArc
tools.one_line_profile: Hierarchical inference of cosmological parameters from strong lensing
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for performing hierarchical inference of cosmological parameters using data from strong gravitational lensing systems.

tools.name: psfr
tools.one_line_profile: Point Spread Function reconstruction tool
tools.detailed_description: A tool for reconstructing the Point Spread Function (PSF) from astronomical images, essential for accurate image analysis and source characterization.

tools.name: Mirage (JWST)
tools.one_line_profile: Simulator for JWST NIRCam, NIRISS, and FGS data
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool developed by STScI to generate simulated data for the NIRCam, NIRISS, and FGS instruments on the James Webb Space Telescope (JWST).

tools.name: Balrog-GalSim
tools.one_line_profile: GalSim modules for the DES Balrog pipeline
tools.detailed_description: A set of modules for GalSim designed to support the Balrog pipeline for the Dark Energy Survey (DES), enabling the injection of synthetic objects into real astronomical images.

tools.name: silkscreen
tools.one_line_profile: Distance measurement to galaxies using ArtPop and SBI
tools.detailed_description: A tool that combines ArtPop (stellar population synthesis) and Simulation-Based Inference (SBI) to measure distances to galaxies directly from their images.

tools.name: online_photometric_calibration
tools.one_line_profile: Implementation of online photometric calibration for vision systems
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of online photometric calibration algorithms, useful for computer vision and robotic visual SLAM systems to handle lighting variations.
